title: Without Aldridge, Spurs tumble in Atlanta

(AP ... more Photo: John Bazemore, Associated Press Image 23 of 24 Atlanta Hawks guard Kent Bazemore (24) scores as San Antonio Spurs forward Kyle Anderson (1) defends in the second half of an NBA basketball exhibition game Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/John Bazemore) Atlanta Hawks guard Kent Bazemore (24) scores as San Antonio Spurs forward Kyle Anderson (1) defends in the second half of an NBA basketball exhibition game Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP ... more Photo: John Bazemore, Associated Press Image 24 of 24 Without Aldridge, Spurs tumble in Atlanta 1 / 24 Back to Gallery ATLANTA — The Earth did not tilt off its axis with 6:28 remaining in the second quarter Wednesday at Philips Arena.
Gravity did not come unhinged. Tectonic plates did not shift.
It only felt that way.
When Spurs coach Gregg Popovich and his Atlana counterpart Mike Budenholzer each opted to dispatch his team’s 7-foot-3 rookie at the same time, Boban Marjanovic took one look at Edy Taveras and uttered a phrase he has seldom used before.
“He’s tall,” Marjanovic said.
The battle between the two castoffs from Gath — Google Goliath’s hometown — served as a circus sideshow for the Spurs’ 100-86 loss to the Hawks.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com.
